text:
Pity to see all the big slides closed which the kids loved so much.
Reason provided by Zoo staff is the ‘many injuries’ despite all clear and unmistakable signs. The slides had also signs not to walk the slope upwards.

WHERE ARE THE PARENTS to properly instruct and supervise their kids what to do and what not?

In lack of that, Singapore is one kids attraction poorer.

To all the parents: Don’t ‘dump’ your kids to such places without supervising and instructing them. It’s not the Zoos responsibility.
It’s yours!

Sad.

@Zoo Team: prices for ice cream, drinks and refreshments are exorbitant. That’s rip-off.

Small waterplay facility located inside Bird Paradise. What u see is what you get, no big wow....

Opens at 0930H daily, do check if your day of visit happen to be maintennace day at their website. Waterplay may close due to foul weather.

Either u walk up the 'hill' or take free shuttle from atation 1 to station 2.

Washroom and Shower facility available on site. But bring your own shampoo and body wash.

Watercooler and baby room available on site too.

Great fun for the 15 month old. I was sorely unprepared for waterplay, and was saved by Sean, a staff from birds paradise who informed me that they do have diapers on hand within the first aid room, accessible via staff. Thank you staff!

There's also a quiet aircon room right next to the shower facilities for everyone. Really appreciate these touches.
Kids having fun. Good shower facilities
